parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post refers to Ovidiu Bistrian, but not in the context of the parliamentary elections.  The post focuses on his actions as a County Councilor, discussing specific projects and votes within the County Council.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The content discusses matters of public interest concerning the Caraș-Severin County.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to inform the public about Ovidiu Bistrian's activities as a County Councilor. While he is a politician, the post does not advocate for his election or re-election to any office. The focus is on his actions regarding specific projects and votes within the County Council, not on influencing votes in a parliamentary election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of citizen journalism, reporting on local political events and decisions. It provides information about specific projects and votes, without explicitly urging voters to support or oppose any candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post presents itself as a factual account of the councilor's actions and votes, not as a personal opinion piece.  While it expresses support for the projects, this is presented as a reasoned stance based on the perceived benefits to the community.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1137561861306252</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on Ovidiu Bistrian's actions as a County Councilor, discussing specific projects and votes within the County Council.  It does not advocate for his election or re-election to any office, nor does it attempt to influence voters in the context of the parliamentary elections. The content is informative, reporting on local political events and decisions, similar to citizen journalism.  While the post expresses support for certain projects, this is presented as a reasoned stance based on the perceived benefits to the community, not as an attempt to sway votes in a parliamentary election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
